intro: Helianthopsis nigrescens, commonly known as the blackening helianthopsis, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its compact, shrub-like growth habit. The plant produces small, yellow to orange flowers that bloom in late summer and early fall. Its leaves are typically gray-green and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in arid environments. Helianthopsis nigrescens is adapted to rocky soils and full sun, making it a resilient species in desert ecosystems.
